> I'll give him this: he has amazing balls to be using Frank's device  
> and tell ing the rest who are also using them that his is the only  
> one that works. If I were Frank, I'd be beating my head against the  
> wall. Oh. Wait. He already is.
>
> What a total load of ego-driven crap.
>
> Chris, if you're reading, may I suggest that you are the one who is  
> falling victim to "false" communication? Or that your head is  
> getting waaaay too big? Or if you already know that you're just in  
> it for the cash, that you find another way to pay your bills?
>
> You know, though, this same shit has happened to every group of  
> paranormal researchers since the field began. I've watched group  
> after group come together and explode for thirty years because only  
> the Chosen had the right to control the message, would broke no  
> criticism of *any* of their own results *ever*, but had plenty of  
> definitive pronouncements about everyone else's.
>
> This is why I scoff at the idea of "Harmony," with the capital H. I  
> have seen the concept used by everyone from the Warrens in the  
> 60s-70s to the Harsch-Fischbachs in the early 80s to Moon today  
> trying to use this idea of being somehow chosen and sacred in order  
> to get "real" messages from spirit. Harmony is a way to control who  
> gets to play and IMHO, it's a load of nonsense.
>
> Bruce, I have to tell you that the message you got the other day  
> about us being all Kumbaya set my alarms off, perhaps innocently,  
> but nonetheless. I've found there is such a fine line between real  
> peace between brothers working for the real common good and peace  
> between brothers as a mechanism of control. Yes, we need to be at  
> peace to work together. But that peace has to be an inclusive  
> peace. It has to be a peace within one's self above all else. It  
> needs to be a *fearless* interior peace, too. The Harmony is  
> within, folks. It's not judging whether others have it or not  
> before we let them play. It is pure, unadulterated *internal*  
> knowledge about one's self. Judge not, lest ye be judged--remember  
> that one?
>
> HMO YMMV, toujours,
>
> Ann
